result.execSummary:
The defendant Seville E Small was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Seville E Small in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. David Siettmann appeared for the Department of Corrections. Based upon the defendant's non compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days condition time in the House of Correction, with credit for 26 days time served.

Per the agent's request, case is scheduled for a probation reveiw hearing on 07/08/2016 at 08:30 a.m.
Public Defender's Office notified.  Bailiff in court notified to have the defendant produced from the House of Correction.
cab
Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 36, Judge Kremers, for review.  jm

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X ]   Review / Modification Request / Recommended
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Seville E Small in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12-18-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by Amber P., the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 5  months in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 6 days served.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 5  months in the House of Correction consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; credit for Zero days served.

As to both counts:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS (Probation sentence is concurrent) with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 30 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Mgmnt. program
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- No contact with the victim that rises to the level of probable cause
- No violent contact with the victim.  
- Any contact with the victim must include a third party "neutral" adult
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Attend the probation review hearing on December 18, 2015

Appeal rights given.

As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Seville E Small in court with Attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files Amended Information with the court:
Count 1 and Count 2:  Misdemeanor Battery, a Class A misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a)

Arraignment held.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Seville E Small in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing.  Due to lateness of the hour, matter adjourned to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Mother of the victim addressed the court, court held colloquy regarding scheduling. 

Court ordered that THIS MATTER IS SCHEDULED FOR  4:00 P.M.  to allow for victim on this matter to appear in court and be present for the hearing. 

Case adjourned to branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Seville E Small in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling. Defendant requested case be set for Plea & Sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Seville E Small in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements signed and filed.  rmm
Signature bond signed in the county jail to continue. Signature bond paperwork not in file.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SLS (DOB 2/10/10), unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's COurt is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Seville E Small in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/21/15 @ 1:30 pm
